problem_text:
Let G = ⟨a, b | r = 1⟩ where r is a cyclically reduced word that is not a proper power of any word in a, b. If G is residually finite, is Gt = ⟨a, b | rt = 1⟩, t > 1, residually finite?
Editors’ comment: An analogous fact was proved for relative one-relator groups (S. J. Pride, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 136, no. 2 (2008), 377–386).
C. Y. Tang
answer: Yes, it is (D. T. Wise, The structure of groups with a quasiconvex hierarchy, Annals of Mathematics Studies, 209, Princeton University Press, Princeton, NJ, 2021).
